Today, I voted in favor of a continuing resolution (CR) that largely maintains current funding levels (clean) through November 21, 2025. While CRs are never optimal, given that we need seven Democrat votes to pass any funding bills in the Senate, I believe that passing this CR was our best play for minimizing spending. The other option was a government shutdown. The seven Democrats will want increased spending in certain areas if we go down a path of modifications, and that will lead to greater deficit spending. If we maintain current levels for this next year, it results in a savings of $500 billion over the next ten years, as it allows inflation to work against typical growth of government year over year.

“For us to hate those who are in error, or talk of them with contempt or wish them ill, or do them wrong, is not according to the Spirit of Christ. You cannot cast out Satan by Satan, nor correct error by violence, nor overcome hate by hate. The conquering weapon of the Christian is love.”

For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war according to the flesh, for the weapons of our warfare are not of the flesh, but divinely powerful for the destruction of fortresses. Every person is to be in subjection to the governing authorities. For there is no authority except from God, and those which exist are established by God.
